Iron Helmet.name: Iron Helmet
description: An iron helmet showing rust on its edges.
Cloth covering the mouth and neck provides some resistance to poison and other irritants.

Scale Armor.name: Scale Armor
Scale Armor.summary: Armor composed of small metal plates
description: Armor reinforced with small metal scales.
The cape covering the shoulders is made with treated rock lizard skin, and provides ample protection against fire.

Iron Gauntlets.name: Iron Gauntlets
description: Ordinary iron gauntlets.

Leather Trousers.name: Leather Trousers
description: Well-made leather trousers.
The lower legs are each bound in cord for ease of movement.

Kaiden Helm.name: Kaiden Helm
description: Helm worn by Kaiden sellswords.
These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback.
Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

Kaiden Armor.name: Kaiden Armor
description: Armor worn by Kaiden sellswords.
Made with the pelt of a snow-wolf, which protects against the cold.
These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback.
Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

Drake Knight Helm.name: Drake Knight Helm
Drake Knight Helm.summary: Malformed helm fused with dragon flesh
description: Black iron helm worn by drake knights.
Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion.
From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.

description: Helm worn by Old Knight Istvan.
The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks.
Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.

Perfumer Hood.name: Perfumer Hood
Perfumer Hood.summary: Hood of an Erdtree Capital perfumer
description: Hood of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

In times past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.

Perfumer Robe.name: Perfumer Robe
Perfumer Robe.summary: Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer
description: Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.
The thick front apron embroidered with a depiction of the Erdtree is proof of mastery of the apothecarial arts, and its weight symbolizes the onus of both pride and responsibility.

Perfumer Gloves.name: Perfumer Gloves
Perfumer Gloves.summary: Gloves of an Erdtree Capital perfumer
description: Gloves of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

Traveler's Hat.name: Traveler's Hat
Traveler's Hat.summary: Leather tricorne of an unaffiliated perfumer
description: Hat of a traveling perfumer of no renown.
An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen, and all those seen as impure.

Perfumer's Traveling Garb.name: Perfumer's Traveling Garb
description: Garb of a traveling perfumer of no renown.
The thick front apron, the badge of a perfumer, has been replaced with a more simple one made from soft leather.

Alberich's Pointed Hat.name: Alberich's Pointed Hat
Alberich's Pointed Hat.summary: Hat of a defected glintstone sorcerer
description: Mad Tongue Alberich's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner.
Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery.
Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

Bull-Goat Helm.name: Bull-Goat Helm
description: Great Horned Tragoth's helm, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provides high poise.
Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.

Bull-Goat Armor.name: Bull-Goat Armor
description: Great Horned Tragoth's armor. Covers its wearer with a pair of giant horns, providing staunch poise.

The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.

description: Coarse hooded cloak of olive brown.
The garb of those accused of lesser crimes, indicated by the collar of sharpened branches.

Cloth Garb.name: Cloth Garb
description: Clothing made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.

Cloth Trousers.name: Cloth Trousers
description: Trousers made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.

Black Wolf Mask.name: Black Wolf Mask
Black Wolf Mask.summary: Helm made with the head of an old wolf
description: A mask fashioned after the head of a black wolf.
Relic of an assassin who assumed the guise of Ranni the Witch's loyal shadow. The likeness is striking.

Blaidd's Armor.name: Blaidd's Armor
Blaidd's Armor.summary: Armor of Blaidd, Knight of Ranni
description: Well-worn black armor of the man-wolf Blaidd.
The pelt serves as a cape, protecting from cold.
Blaidd was the blade of Ranni, but the cold bothered him anyway.

Blaidd's Gauntlets.name: Blaidd's Gauntlets
Blaidd's Gauntlets.summary: Gauntlets of Blaidd, Knight of Ranni
description: Well-worn black gauntlets of the man-wolf Blaidd.
Blaidd, who served as Ranni's shadow, was a loyal ally who would defy destiny itself if it would have him turn upon his Lady.

Blaidd's Greaves.name: Blaidd's Greaves

Black Knife Hood.summary: Hood used by the Black Blade Assassins
description: Hood used by the Black Knife Assassins.
The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

Black Knife Armor.name: Black Knife Armor
Black Knife Armor.summary: Armor used by the Black Blade Assassins
description: Scale armor used by the Black Knife Assassins, forged to make no sound.

Banished Knight Helm.name: Banished Knight Helm
Banished Knight Helm.summary: Knight's helm covered in a long cloth of deep red
description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body.
This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.
Perhaps the deep-red scarf was used to block the winds, for on the outskirts, the winds bite with a stinging fierceness.

Banished Knight Armor.name: Banished Knight Armor
Banished Knight Armor.summary: Knight's armor, worn by salt winds and battle
description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body.
This armor was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.
These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

Briar Helm.name: Briar Helm
description: Battered iron helm from a foreign land.
Worn by Elemer of the Briar.
The winding, rusted iron briars are a mark of the guilty, and typically indicate a sentence of death. They also cause this armor to deal damage when performing dodge rolls.
Elemer murdered numerous instructors and merchants, and was known as the Bell Bearing Hunter.

description: Hood worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.
The unassuming sack-like appearance befits their unseen and unknown stature.

Page Garb.name: Page Garb
description: Garb worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.
Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.

description: Pitch-black helm with flowing black hair.
Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.
The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads of night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.

description: Chainmail hood crafted with blue silver.
Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.
Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

Nomadic Merchant's Chapeau.name: Nomadic Merchant's Chapeau
description: Chapeau of the nomadic merchants.
Decorated with tiny gems in a wide spectrum of colors.
These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground.
Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

description: Trousers of the nomadic merchants.
These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground.
Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

description: Finery of the nomadic merchants.
Decorated with tiny gems in a wide spectrum of colors.

Malformed Dragon Helm.name: Malformed Dragon Helm
Malformed Dragon Helm.summary: Malformed, golden helm used by Gnarrl
description: A malformed golden helm.
Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels.
After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

Royal Knight Helm.name: Royal Knight Helm
description: Silver helm of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.
Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

Royal Knight Armor.name: Royal Knight Armor
description: Silver armor of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.
Loretta was once a royal Carian knight, and her lapis-lazuli blue cape is the emblem of the knightly pride that continues to guide her.

Nox Monk Hood.name: Nox Monk Hood
Nox Monk Hood.summary: Hood worn by members of the Empyrean family
description: Silk hood worn by the monks of the Eternal City.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Nox Monk Armor.summary: Armor worn by members of the Empyrean family
description: Armor worn by the monks of the Eternal City, with a silk cape attached.

description: Crown worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City.

Great Horned Headband.name: Great Horned Headband
Great Horned Headband.summary: Headband worn by worshippers of stag specters
description: Headband decorated by a pair of great horns.
Worn by ancestral follower warriors.
The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

Fur Raiment.summary: Garb worn by worshippers of stag specters
description: Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt.

description: Leggings fashioned from bristly pelts.
Worn by ancestral follower warriors.
The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

Shining Horned Headband.name: Shining Horned Headband
description: Headband decorated by a pair of shining horns.
Worn by ancestral follower shamans.
Horns with buds that also shine are ideal ceremonial items for ancestral worship. Strengthens Ancestral Infant's Head.

Shaman Furs.name: Shaman Furs
description: Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt.

Duelist Helm.name: Duelist Helm
Duelist Helm.summary: Bronze helm adorned with many snakes
description: Bronze helm decorated with innumerable snakes.
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.
The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

Gravekeeper Cloak.name: Gravekeeper Cloak
Gravekeeper Cloak.summary: Robe made from a beast pelt
description: Thick, bristly cloak that is the symbol of an underground gravekeeper.
Those who once fought for a living were driven from the colosseum, and becoming guardians of Erdtree Burial.

Duelist Greaves.name: Duelist Greaves
description: Greaves encircled by bronze snakes.
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.
The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

Gravekeeper Cloak (Altered).name: Gravekeeper Cloak (Altered)
description: Defensive wear encircled by bronze snakes.
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.
The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

Sanguine Noble Hood.name: Sanguine Noble Hood
Sanguine Noble Hood.summary: Hood made from tanned Demigod skin
description: Hood made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.
Worn by the Godskin Apostles.
The apostles, once said to serve Destined Death, are wielders of the god-slaying black flame. But after their defeat by Maliketh, the Black Blade, the source of their power was sealed away.

Sanguine Noble Robe.name: Sanguine Noble Robe
Sanguine Noble Robe.summary: Robe made from tanned Demigod skin
description: Robe made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.

Sanguine Noble Waistcloth.name: Sanguine Noble Waistcloth
description: Waistcloth sewn from black cloth.
Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.
Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.

Guardian Mask.name: Guardian Mask
Guardian Mask.summary: Mask worn by the people of rotted abundance
description: Engraved golden mask.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.
In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

Guardian Garb (Full Bloom).name: Guardian Garb (Full Bloom)
Guardian Garb (Full Bloom).summary: Armor worn by the people of rotted abundance
description: Engraved golden garb.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.
Raises the HP recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears, but greatly lowers fire damage negation.
It is said that the blood-red flowers blooming on their backs mark the senescence of their ancient pact. Perhaps the guardians are part tree already.

Guardian Bracers.name: Guardian Bracers
Guardian Bracers.summary: Gauntlets worn by the people of rotted abundance
description: Engraved golden bracers.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

Cleanrot Helm.name: Cleanrot Helm
Cleanrot Helm.summary: Helm of a Wing Knight. Somewhat decayed...
description: Winged helm of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.
The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

Fire Monk Hood.name: Fire Monk Hood
Fire Monk Hood.summary: Mail helm covering a headband engraved with flames
description: Mail hood of iron links covering a headband
engraved with flames. Attire of the Fire Monks.
The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

Fire Monk Armor.name: Fire Monk Armor
Fire Monk Armor.summary: Fire Monk armor adorned with a red cloth
description: Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth.
Attire of the Fire Monks.
The grotesque face sculpted on the chest is said to depict the corrupt ancient god of the flame.
Taboos transform into lasting obsessions by virtue of the fear that they inspire.

Fire Monk Gauntlets.name: Fire Monk Gauntlets
Fire Monk Gauntlets.summary: Fire Monk gauntlets which resemble flames
description: Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif.
Attire of the Fire Monks.
The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

Fire Monk Greaves.name: Fire Monk Greaves

description: Black iron greaves featuring a flame motif.
Attire of the Fire Monks.

Blackflame Monk Hood.name: Blackflame Monk Hood
Blackflame Monk Hood.summary: Chain helm worn above a fire shaped crown
description: Mail hood of iron links covering a headband
engraved with flames. Attire of the Blackflame Monks.
The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

Blackflame Monk Armor.name: Blackflame Monk Armor
Blackflame Monk Armor.summary: Godskin Monk armor adorned with a white cloth

Fire Prelate Helm.name: Fire Prelate Helm
Fire Prelate Helm.summary: Fire Prelate helm sculpted in the image of a sage
description: Helm engraved with a sacred countenance and housing a cauldron.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

It is said the cauldron perched atop the head was originally furnished with embers, and would surge into flames when the wearer's faith reached its zenith. The fire of this cauldron has since died out, however.

Fire Prelate Armor.name: Fire Prelate Armor
Fire Prelate Armor.summary: Fire Prelate armor adorned with a red cloth
description: Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.
The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."

Fire Prelate Gauntlets.name: Fire Prelate Gauntlets
Fire Prelate Gauntlets.summary: Fire Prelate gauntlets which resemble flames
description: Black iron gauntlets with the appearance of flames.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.
The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."

Vulgar Militia Helm.name: Vulgar Militia Helm
description: Helm worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.
The upward extension serves to create an appearance of larger size, however slightly.

Vulgar Militia Armor.name: Vulgar Militia Armor
description: Armor worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.

Vulgar Militia Gauntlets.name: Vulgar Militia Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.

Sage Hood.name: Sage Hood
Sage Hood.summary: Hood of a travelling musician gripped by death
description: A burgundy pointed hood.
Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.
Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

Sage Robe.name: Sage Robe
Sage Robe.summary: Robe of a travelling musician gripped by death
description: Thick burgundy robe.
Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.
Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

Sage Trousers.name: Sage Trousers
Sage Trousers.summary: Waistcloth of travelling musician gripped by death
description: Thick burgundy trousers.
Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.
Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

Pumpkin Helm.name: Pumpkin Helm
Pumpkin Helm.summary: Oval helmet large enough to cover any head
description: An oval helm large enough to cover any head.
Very heavy and very hard.
Reduces damage from headshots and impacts.
The inside of the helm is pitch black, keeping the crazed warrior within from panicking.
Perhaps its rather roomy interior also helps alleviate feelings of pressure and claustrophobia.

Elden Lord Crown.name: Elden Lord Crown
Elden Lord Crown.summary: Crown of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord
description: Crown of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.
The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield.

He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

Radahn inherited the furious, flaming red hair of his father Radagon, and is fond of its heroic implications.
"I was born a champion's cub. Now I am the Lord of the Battlefield's lion."

Radahn's Lion Armor.summary: Armor of Radahn, God of War
description: Armor depicting the golden lion.
Worn by General Radahn.
The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

description: Black bracelets of the Godskin Apostles.
The apostles, once said to serve Destined Death, are wielders of the god-slaying black flame. But after their defeat by Maliketh, the Black Blade, the source of their power was sealed away.

Godskin Apostle Hood.summary: Hood made from tanned corpulent Demigod skin
description: Hood made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.
Subcutaneous fat makes it plump and soft.
Worn by Godskin Nobles.
Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

Godskin Apostle Robe.name: Godskin Apostle Robe

description: Robe made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.

Lusat's Glintstone Crown.summary: Skull-merged Crown of a Crystal Sorcerer
description: The giant blue glintstone crown worn by Lusat, primeval current sorcerer.

This crown replaced Lusat's brain and skull altogether, and now, removed from his body, it is all but dead. What power remains within raises the potency of Lusat's primeval current sorceries at the cost of additional FP consumption.

Lusat's Robe.name: Lusat's Robe
Lusat's Robe.summary: Dull red robe of a Crystal Sorcerer
description: A robe reserved for grand masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Corroded by blue glintstones.
Since the grand masters Azur and Lusat were driven from the academy, no one has achieved their formerly-held rank.

Lusat's Manchettes.name: Lusat's Manchettes
Lusat's Manchettes.summary: Dull red  arm wraps of a Crystal Sorcerer
description: Manchettes corroded by blue glintstones.

Old Sorcerer's Legwraps.summary: Dull red waistcloth of a Crystal Sorcerer

All-Knowing Helm.name: All-Knowing Helm
All-Knowing Helm.summary: Helm of Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing
description: Helm set with countless eyes and ears.
Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing.
Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear.
At the end that should not be.

Twinned Helm.name: Twinned Helm
Twinned Helm.summary: Helm worn by D, Knight of the Golden Order
description: Helm depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.
The two known as D are inseparable twins.
They are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. Not once do they stand together; not one word do they speak to one another.
Perhaps this armor longs to find its way to the other D.

Prophet Blindfold.name: Prophet Blindfold
description: Blindfold of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune - and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.
Why hesitate, if the path leading to the future is clear? Just close your eyes, and walk.

Corhyn's Robe.name: Corhyn's Robe
description: Robe of Corhyn the cleric.
Even after exile, Corhyn refused to recant his prophecies. And for this, he was blessed with the guidance of grace.
Since then, the cart wheel draped on his neck has served as a reminder. That true guidance awaits those with iron wills. Those with unwavering faith.

Prophet Trousers.name: Prophet Trousers
description: Trousers of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune - and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.
Made from rough fabric that scrapes against the skin like a sharpening file.

The shackles around the neck warn passersby not to lend an ear to their sermons.

Astrologer Hood.name: Astrologer Hood
description: Hood fashioned from supple cloth.
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.
They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.
But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

description: Round iron helm with a distinctive large brim.
Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.
When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.

Hoslow's Helm.name: Hoslow's Helm
Hoslow's Helm.summary: Heavy helm passed down through the Hoslow family
description: A twin-tailed silver helm decorated with flowery adornments. Symbol of the head of the revered House of Hoslow.
Juno Hoslow had a younger brother who was all talk and no trousers.
His inability to commit to action was such that Juno inherited the Hoslow legacy without resistance, granting him the freedom to shower his little brother with adoration.

Hoslow's Armor.name: Hoslow's Armor
Hoslow's Armor.summary: Armor passed down through the Hoslow family
description: Garish silver armor decorated with red embellishments.
Passed down through the Hoslow family.
When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused.
"I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."

Hoslow's Gauntlets.name: Hoslow's Gauntlets
Hoslow's Gauntlets.summary: Gauntlets passed down through the Hoslow family
description: Garish silver gauntlets decorated with red embellishments.

"I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."

Diallos's Mask.name: Diallos's Mask
Diallos's Mask.summary: Helm passed down through the Hoslow family
description: Replica of a twin-tailed silver helm with flowery adornments. Only, without the twin tails.
Diallos Hoslow had an older brother who was a stern, self-possessed man of few words. His achievements made him seem out of reach.
And so the younger aspired to be like the older. Yearning for the day that he would tell the tale of House Hoslow, in blood. Knowing full well that it would break his brother's heart.

description: Helm of a knight banished from their motherland.
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.
The visor is broken and can no longer be lowered.
Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

Vagabond Knight Armor.name: Vagabond Knight Armor
description: Chest piece of a knight banished from their motherland.
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.
The crest emblazoned on the front is worn and dingy, no longer able to evoke sentiment.
Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

Vagabond Knight Gauntlets.name: Vagabond Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of a knight banished from their motherland.
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.
Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

description: Greaves of a knight banished from their motherland.
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

Blue Cloth Cowl.name: Blue Cloth Cowl
Blue Cloth Cowl.summary: Cowl of a nomadic warrior, made of blue cloth
description: Cowl of a nomadic warrior.
The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer.
Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay.
Warriors must remain ever drifting.

Blue Cloth Vest.name: Blue Cloth Vest
Blue Cloth Vest.summary: Vest of a nomadic warrior, made of blue cloth
description: Vest of a nomadic warrior.
The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer.
Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay.
Warriors must remain ever drifting.

Warrior Gauntlets.name: Warrior Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of a nomadic warrior.
Crafted from sturdy leather.

Warrior Greaves.name: Warrior Greaves
description: Greaves of a nomadic warrior.
Crafted from sturdy leather.

White Mask.name: White Mask
White Mask.summary: Strange birch mask that hides one's expression
description: Bloodstained, faintly grinning white mask.
Worn by war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.
The Lord of Blood's curse enlivens the wearer when bloodletting occurs. Slightly raises attack power when there is blood loss nearby.

conditions: Trigger in Presence of Blood Loss

War Surgeon Gown.name: War Surgeon Gown
War Surgeon Gown.summary: Old white tunic, stained with blood
description: Bloodstained white gown of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.
Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood.
None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.

War Surgeon Gloves.name: War Surgeon Gloves
War Surgeon Gloves.summary: Physician's gloves made from thick leather
description: Bloodstained white gloves of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.
Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood.
None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.

War Surgeon Trousers.name: War Surgeon Trousers
War Surgeon Trousers.summary: Physician's trousers made from thick leather
description: Bloodstained trousers of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.
Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood.
None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.

Royal Remains Helm.name: Royal Remains Helm
Royal Remains Helm.summary: Mask that mediates via body of famed ancestor
description: Helm graced with gold human bones.
Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.
Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced.
It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lord―the soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.

Royal Remains Armor.name: Royal Remains Armor
Royal Remains Armor.summary: Armor that mediates via body of famed ancestor
description: Armor graced with gold human bones.
Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

Brave's Cord Circlet.name: Brave's Cord Circlet
Brave's Cord Circlet.summary: Headband of a warrior of the frigid uplands
description: Warrior's headband of woven leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.
The small flags, white cloths and sheaves of wheat
often found hung from these headbands are
prayers of farewell from the people of their home.
In bidding farewell to warriors departing on
a journey from which they aren't like to return,
this small act offers only meager relief.

Brave's Battlewear.name: Brave's Battlewear
Brave's Battlewear.summary: Battlewear of a warrior of the frigid uplands
description: Battlewear fashioned from leather armor
adorned with a large sheet of cloth.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.
The red cloth signifies participation in the
Long March long, long ago and this ceremonial
garb beseeches the favor of the Warrior King
who led them.

Brave's Bracer.name: Brave's Bracer
Brave's Bracer.summary: Gauntlets of a warrior of the frigid uplands
description: Gauntlets wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.
Has a fur lining which excels at keeping
the cold at bay.

Brave's Legwraps.name: Brave's Legwraps
Brave's Legwraps.summary: Greaves of a warrior of the frigid uplands
description: Greaves wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.
Has a fur lining which excels at keeping
the cold at bay.

Brave's Leather Helm.name: Brave's Leather Helm
Brave's Leather Helm.summary: Helm of a warrior of the frigid uplands
description: Battlewear wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

Brave's Battlewear (Altered).name: Brave's Battlewear (Altered)
Brave's Battlewear (Altered).summary: Battlewear of a warrior of the frigid uplands
description: Helm wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

Beast Champion Helm.name: Beast Champion Helm
description: Silver helm engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.
The beasts, their eyes and ears covered, represent an oath: "See nothing, hear nothing, doubt nothing, and carry on, along the path set in stone."

Beast Champion Armor.name: Beast Champion Armor
description: Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.
Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.
Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

Beast Champion Gauntlets.name: Beast Champion Gauntlets
description: Silver gauntlets engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.
Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.
Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

Beast Champion Greaves.name: Beast Champion Greaves
description: Silver greaves engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.
Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.
Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

Beast Champion Armor (Altered).name: Beast Champion Armor (Altered)
description: Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.
Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.

Champion Headband.name: Champion Headband
Champion Headband.summary: Headband reserved for the badlands' bravest
description: Headband reserved for the badlands' bravest.
Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes.
Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

Champion Pauldron.name: Champion Pauldron
Champion Pauldron.summary: Pauldron reserved for the badlands' bravest
description: Pauldron reserved for the badlands' bravest.
Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes.
Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

Champion Bracers.name: Champion Bracers
Champion Bracers.summary: Gauntlets reserved for the badlands' bravest
description: Bracers reserved for the badlands' bravest.
Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes.
Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

Champion Gaiters.name: Champion Gaiters
Champion Gaiters.summary: Gaiters formed only of leather straps
description: Gaiters formed only with leather straps.
Common wear in the badlands.

Crimson Hood.name: Crimson Hood
description: A hooded cloak of vivid crimson.
Worn by expatriated royalty.
Increases vigor.

Such cloaks were gifted to those who departed on journeys without specific orders, to faraway lands from which they would never return. In other words, the gift of a cloak made it easier for undesirables to be on their way.
Roderika never once saw the guidance of grace.

Noble's Traveling Garb.name: Noble's Traveling Garb
description: Traveling attire fashioned from metallic white silk thread. Worn by expatriated royalty.
A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

Noble's Gloves.name: Noble's Gloves
description: Gloves of plush leather.
Worn by expatriated royalty.
A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

Noble's Trousers.name: Noble's Trousers
description: White trousers of superior craftsmanship.
Worn by expatriated royalty.
A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

Navy Hood.name: Navy Hood
description: A hooded cloak of deep navy.
Worn by expatriated royalty.
Increases mind.
Such cloaks were gifted to those who departed on missions to faraway lands, from which they would never return. But what choice did they have, having seen the guidance of grace?

Maliketh's Helm.name: Maliketh's Helm
Maliketh's Helm.summary: Helm of Maliketh the Black Blade
description: Beast's helm made of black iron and decorated with gold.
Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.
Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him.
Champions knew what was at stake.
Indeed, that is what made them champions.

Maliketh's Armor.name: Maliketh's Armor
Maliketh's Armor.summary: Armor of Maliketh the Black Blade
description: Beast's armor made of black iron and decorated with gold.

Malenia's Winged Helm.name: Malenia's Winged Helm
description: Winged helm made of unalloyed gold.
Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella.
Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk.
"My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god - he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

description: Armor made of unalloyed gold.

Veteran's Helm.name: Veteran's Helm
description: An old helm that has seen many battles.
Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.
Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master.
This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

description: Old armor that has seen many battles.

Bloodhound Knight Helm.name: Bloodhound Knight Helm
Bloodhound Knight Helm.summary: Beast-like helm of the Bloodhound Knights
description: Metal helm with a pointed beak.
Worn by the Bloodhound Knights.
The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.
Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master.
Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

Bloodhound Knight Armor.name: Bloodhound Knight Armor
Bloodhound Knight Armor.summary: Beast-like armor of the Bloodhound Knights
description: Metal armor with a jutting breastplate.
Worn by the Bloodhound Knights.
The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.
Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master.
Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

Festive Hood.name: Festive Hood
Festive Hood.summary: Hood worn for a humble festival
description: Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.
Decorated with many-colored flowers.

Festive Garb.name: Festive Garb
Festive Garb.summary: Cloak worn for a humble festival
description: Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.
Faintly bloodstained.

Festive Hood (Altered).name: Festive Hood (Altered)
Festive Hood (Altered).summary: Wreath of flowers worn for a humble festival
description: Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.
Decorated with a stunning array of flowers.

Festive Garb (Altered).name: Festive Garb (Altered)
Festive Garb (Altered).summary: Ceremonial garb worn for a humble festival
description: Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.
Faintly bloodstained.

Blue Festive Hood.name: Blue Festive Hood
Blue Festive Hood.summary: Hood worn for a humble festival
description: Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.
Use of this hood, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.

Blue Festive Garb.name: Blue Festive Garb
Blue Festive Garb.summary: Cloak worn for a humble festival
description: Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.
Use of this garb, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.

Commoner's Headband.name: Commoner's Headband
Commoner's Headband.summary: Hood of a rune cursed citizen
description: A headband that holds cloth in place.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.
Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.

Commoner's Garb.name: Commoner's Garb
Commoner's Garb.summary: Garb of a rune cursed citizen
description: Garb with a thick embroidered cape attached.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.
The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

Commoner's Shoes.name: Commoner's Shoes
Commoner's Shoes.summary: Waistcloth of a rune cursed citizen
description: Modest shoes made of cloth.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.
Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.

Commoner's Headband (Altered).name: Commoner's Headband (Altered)
Commoner's Headband (Altered).summary: Garb of a rune cursed citizen
description: A headband with the cloth removed.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.
Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.

Commoner's Garb (Altered).name: Commoner's Garb (Altered)
Commoner's Garb (Altered).summary: Garb of a rune cursed citizen
description: Garb decorated with intricate embroidery.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.
The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

Commoner's Simple Garb.name: Commoner's Simple Garb
Commoner's Simple Garb.summary: Crown of a rune cursed citizen
description: Garb with a modest cloth cape attached.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.
The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

Commoner's Simple Garb (Altered).name: Commoner's Simple Garb (Altered)
Commoner's Simple Garb (Altered).summary: Garb of a rune cursed citizen
description: Modest garb made of cloth.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.
The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

Envoy Crown.name: Envoy Crown
description: The soft bundle worn on the head by Oracle Envoys.
Densely wrapped in several layers of cloth.
Raises the potency of bubble-based skills.
No one knows what the cloth hides, but some claim to have heard a faint whimpering from inside. It must have been their imagination.

Twinsage Glintstone Crown.name: Twinsage Glintstone Crown
Twinsage Glintstone Crown.summary: Stone mask of the Twin Crystal Sage
description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.
Greatly increases intelligence to the detriment of HP and stamina.
Scholars of the Twinsage Conspectus were the elites of the academy, permitted to study and excel in sorceries of all kinds.

Raya Lucarian Robe.name: Raya Lucarian Robe
Raya Lucarian Robe.summary: Robe worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars
description: Robe worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery.
Those who dedicate themselves to the study of glintstones formed from starry amber receive this modest yet elegant deep navy garb after making their vows of virtue and austerity.
But with extended life, one is apt to forget old vows.

Sorcerer Manchettes.name: Sorcerer Manchettes
Sorcerer Manchettes.summary: Manchettes worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars
description: Manchettes worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery.
Made by wrapping a simple cloth around the forearms.

Sorcerer Leggings.name: Sorcerer Leggings
Sorcerer Leggings.summary: Leggings worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars
description: Leggings worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery.
Made by wrapping a simple cloth around the legs.

Olivinus Glintstone Crown.name: Olivinus Glintstone Crown
Olivinus Glintstone Crown.summary: Stone mask of a Gold Amber Sage
description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.
Increases intelligence to the detriment of HP.
The lineage of the Olivinus Conspectus began with the sorcerer Lusat, and its adherents continue his study of meteors.

Lazuli Glintstone Crown.name: Lazuli Glintstone Crown
Lazuli Glintstone Crown.summary: Stone mask of a Red Glintstone Sage
description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.
Increases intelligence and dexterity to the detriment of HP.
Scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus study Carian sorceries - a heterodox pursuit that views the moon as equal to the stars.

Karolos Glintstone Crown.name: Karolos Glintstone Crown
Karolos Glintstone Crown.summary: Stone mask depicting the wise Karolos
description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.
Increases intelligence to the detriment of stamina.
The Karolos Conspectus is the oldest of the academy's lineages of study, begat by the sorcerer Azur. Scholars who follow in his footsteps pursue the mysteries of comets.

Witch's Glintstone Crown.name: Witch's Glintstone Crown
Witch's Glintstone Crown.summary: Stone mask of a Green Glintstone Sage
description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.
Increases intelligence and arcane to the detriment of stamina.
This gentle-looking crown was granted to a scholar who excelled in her studies, which also merited the title of "witch."

Marionette Soldier Helm.name: Marionette Soldier Helm
Marionette Soldier Helm.summary: Cylindrical helm worn by marionette soldiers
description: Cylindrical helm of plate metal reinforced with a lattice.
Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.
The construction of this helm is remarkably crude.
For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.

Marionette Soldier Armor.name: Marionette Soldier Armor
Marionette Soldier Armor.summary: Armor of lattice plate worn by marionette soldiers
description: Armor of metal bands arranged in a lattice.
Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.
The construction of this armor is remarkably crude, now rusted over and severely dented.
For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.

Marionette Soldier Birdhelm.name: Marionette Soldier Birdhelm
Marionette Soldier Birdhelm.summary: Iron mask worn by marionette soldiers
description: Metal helm formed in the likeness of the face of a bird.
Worn by avionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.
The construction of this helm is remarkably crude.
For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.

Raging Wolf Helm.name: Raging Wolf Helm
Raging Wolf Helm.summary: Helm of Vargram the Bloody Wolf
description: Helm worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.
Vargram's nickname comes from the white wolf's mane that decorates this helm.

Raging Wolf Armor.name: Raging Wolf Armor
Raging Wolf Armor.summary: Armor of Vargram the Bloody Wolf
description: Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.
According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.

Raging Wolf Gauntlets.name: Raging Wolf Gauntlets
Raging Wolf Gauntlets.summary: Gauntlets of Vargram the Bloody Wolf
description: Gauntlets worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.
According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.

Raging Wolf Greaves.name: Raging Wolf Greaves
Raging Wolf Greaves.summary: Greaves of Vargram the Bloody Wolf
description: Greaves worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.
According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.

Raging Wolf Armor (Altered).name: Raging Wolf Armor (Altered)
Raging Wolf Armor (Altered).summary: Breastplate of Vargram the Bloody Wolf
description: Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.
According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.

Land of Reeds Helm.name: Land of Reeds Helm
Land of Reeds Helm.summary: Helm of a warrior from the land of reeds
description: Helm made from strips of iron fastened together.
Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds.

The Land of Reeds has long been locked in a miserable civil war, during which time it has remained alienated from the cultures of its neighbors. Little wonder that the entire nation has succumbed to blood-soaked madness, or so it is said.

Land of Reeds Armor.name: Land of Reeds Armor
Land of Reeds Armor.summary: Chest piece of a warrior from the land of reeds
description: Armor made from strips of iron fastened together.
Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds.
The grimy outer mantle is made from withered reeds from the warrior's birthplace.
Perhaps its comforts extend to nostalgic thoughts of home.

Land of Reeds Gauntlets.name: Land of Reeds Gauntlets
Land of Reeds Gauntlets.summary: Gauntlets of a warrior from the land of reeds
description: Gauntlets wrapped in tough leather.
Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds.

Land of Reeds Greaves.name: Land of Reeds Greaves
Land of Reeds Greaves.summary: Greaves of a warrior from the land of reeds
description: Greaves wrapped in tough leather.
Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds.

Land of Reeds Armor (Altered).name: Land of Reeds Armor (Altered)
Land of Reeds Armor (Altered).summary: Armor of a warrior from the land of reeds
description: Armor made from strips of iron fastened together.
Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds.

The Land of Reeds has long been locked in a miserable civil war, during which time it has remained alienated from the cultures of its neighbors. Little wonder that the entire nation has succumbed to blood-soaked madness, or so it is said.

Okina Mask.name: Okina Mask
Okina Mask.summary: Mask adorned with a land of reeds veteran warrior
description: A wooden mask that depicts an old man baring his teeth. The source of the sobriquet of the great swordsman of the Land of Reeds.
Raises dexterity as it lowers focus.

The more he sharpened his mind, the more the absurdities of the world came into stark relief. And so Okina renounced it all, and rose to a higher plane. There was only himself. His katana. And its mastery.
Before long, Okina became a demon of a swordsman.

White Reed Armor.name: White Reed Armor
White Reed Armor.summary: Stomach band of a land of reeds veteran warrior
description: Armor of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates.
Worn by the Inaba, head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.
The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat.
To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothing more than to die by the sword.

White Reed Gauntlets.name: White Reed Gauntlets
White Reed Gauntlets.summary: Gauntlets of a land of reeds veteran warrior
description: Gauntlets of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates.
Worn by the Inaba, head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.
The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat.
To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothing more than to die by the sword.

White Reed Greaves.name: White Reed Greaves
White Reed Greaves.summary: Greaves of a land of reeds veteran warrior
description: Greaves of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates.
Worn by the Inaba, head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.
The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat.
To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothing more than to die by the sword.

Confessor Hood.name: Confessor Hood
Confessor Hood.summary: Black hood of those who kill for a living
description: Black hood for blending in with the darkness.
Worn by church confessors.
The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace.
The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Confessor Armor.name: Confessor Armor
Confessor Armor.summary: Black robe of those who kill for a living
description: Black leather armor for blending in with the darkness.
Worn by church confessors.
The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace.
The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Confessor Gloves.name: Confessor Gloves
Confessor Gloves.summary: Gloves of those who kill for a living
description: Black leather gloves of the church confessors.
The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace.
The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Confessor Boots.name: Confessor Boots
Confessor Boots.summary: Boots of those who kill for a living
description: Leather boots of the church confessors.
The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace.
The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Confessor Hood (Altered).name: Confessor Hood (Altered)
Confessor Hood (Altered).summary: Mask of those who kill for a living
description: Cloth headwrap worn under a church confessor's black hood.
Such hoods are made for blending in with the darkness.

Confessor Armor (Altered).name: Confessor Armor (Altered)
Confessor Armor (Altered).summary: Vest of those who kill for a living
description: Black leather armor for blending in with the darkness.
Worn by church confessors.
The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace.
The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Prisoner Iron Mask.name: Prisoner Iron Mask
Prisoner Iron Mask.summary: Iron mask worn by grave offenders
description: Iron mask forced on a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime.
Thick, heavy, and utterly stifling.
A foul creation designed to torment the wearer, either slowly fermenting hatred within their heart, or a spiritual fervor that is near indistinguishable from it.

Prisoner Clothing.name: Prisoner Clothing
description: Tattered clothing.
Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime.
Never once washed, every fiber is filthy.

Prisoner Trousers.name: Prisoner Trousers
description: Tattered trousers.
Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime.
Never once washed, every fiber is filthy.
The smell is beyond belief.

Blackguard's Iron Mask.name: Blackguard's Iron Mask
Blackguard's Iron Mask.summary: Iron mask worn by only the most violent offenders
description: Iron mask forced on convicted prisoners.
Worn by the blackguard Big Boggart.
To Boggart, the mask made him all the more threatening, and helped him get what he wanted. But it was also a mirror of his emptiness.

Traveling Maiden Hood.name: Traveling Maiden Hood
description: Hood worn by traveling maidens.
Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

Traveling Maiden Robe.name: Traveling Maiden Robe
description: Robe worn by traveling maidens.
Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

Traveling Maiden Gloves.name: Traveling Maiden Gloves
description: Gloves worn by traveling maidens.
Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

Traveling Maiden Boots.name: Traveling Maiden Boots
description: Boots worn by traveling maidens.
Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

Traveling Maiden Robe (Altered).name: Traveling Maiden Robe (Altered)
description: Modest garb of traveling maidens, typically worn under their robes.

Finger Maiden Fillet.name: Finger Maiden Fillet
description: Fillet worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers.
The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers.
The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

Finger Maiden Robe.name: Finger Maiden Robe
description: Robe worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers.
The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers.
The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

Finger Maiden Shoes.name: Finger Maiden Shoes
description: Shoes worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers.
The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers.
The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

Finger Maiden Robe (Altered).name: Finger Maiden Robe (Altered)
description: Robe worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers.
The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers.
The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

Preceptor's Big Hat.name: Preceptor's Big Hat
description: Large hat with the movements of the stars drawn on the inside of the brim.
Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals.
Increases mind to the detriment of stamina.
Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars.

Preceptor's Long Gown.name: Preceptor's Long Gown
description: A long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it.
Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals.
Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars.

Preceptor's Gloves.name: Preceptor's Gloves
description: Gloves of the magic preceptors who serve the Carian royals.
Black and perfectly discreet.

Preceptor's Trousers.name: Preceptor's Trousers
description: Trousers of the magic preceptors who serve the Carian royals.
Black and perfectly discreet.

Mask of Confidence.name: Mask of Confidence
description: Mask with the mouth sewn shut with gold thread.
Increases arcane.
When Radagon married Rennala, he ordered the Carian magic preceptors to don these masks. To make it clear that all of their matters were to be kept strictly private.

Preceptor's Long Gown (Altered).name: Preceptor's Long Gown (Altered)
description: Modest garb, previously worn under a long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it.

Grass Hair Ornament.name: Grass Hair Ornament
description: A headdress made from wildflowers.
Wearing this might make you less easy to spot.

Skeletal Mask.name: Skeletal Mask
Skeletal Mask.summary: Hood worn by followers of the deadly birds
description: Skeletal mask that tightly grips the face.
Worn by the assassins of Ravenmount.
This ritual implement relentlessly digs into the wearer's face, preserving one's human instincts while dressed in imitation of the Deathbirds.

Raptor's Black Feathers.name: Raptor's Black Feathers
Raptor's Black Feathers.summary: Cloak worn by followers of the deadly birds
description: Robe crafted with the black feathers of a bird of prey.
Worn by the assassins of Ravenmount.
A ritual implement for transforming into a Deathbird, if only by imitation.
Strengthens jump attacks.
"We are birds of prey, bringers of death."

Bandit Manchettes.name: Bandit Manchettes
Bandit Manchettes.summary: Wraps worn by followers of the deadly birds
description: Manchettes made by simply wrapping dirty cloth around the arms.
Worn by bandits.

Bandit Boots.name: Bandit Boots
Bandit Boots.summary: Trousers worn by followers of the deadly birds
description: Leather boots worn by bandits.
Light for ease of movement, and supple for masking sound. In trade, they offer little damage negation.

Bandit Garb.name: Bandit Garb
Bandit Garb.summary: Vest worn by followers of the deadly birds
description: Leather garb worn by bandits.
Light for ease of movement, and supple for masking sound. In trade, they offer little damage negation.

Eccentric's Hood.name: Eccentric's Hood
description: A pointy, ragged hood.
Worn by the knight Jerren.
The hood hides an aged, bearded mask.
Jerren served General Radahn as a guest commander, and they are said to have sworn an oath of honorable death to one another.

Eccentric's Armor.name: Eccentric's Armor
description: Unusually colorful armor.
Worn by the knight Jerren.
Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became a guest commander for General Radahn.
And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.

Eccentric's Manchettes.name: Eccentric's Manchettes
description: The knight Jerren's manchettes.
Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became the guest commander for General Radahn.
And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.

Eccentric's Breeches.name: Eccentric's Breeches
description: The knight Jerren's breeches.
Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became the guest commander for General Radahn.
And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.

Eccentric's Hood (Altered).name: Eccentric's Hood (Altered)
description: A pointy, ragged hood.
Worn by the knight Jerren.
The hood hides an aged, bearded mask.
Jerren served General Radahn as a guest commander, and they are said to have sworn an oath of honorable death to one another.

Fingerprint Helm.name: Fingerprint Helm
Fingerprint Helm.summary: Deformed helm of a mad knight in despair
description: Iron helm singed and blistered by fingers.
Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold.
No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy.
Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

Fingerprint Armor.name: Fingerprint Armor
Fingerprint Armor.summary: Deformed armor of a mad knight in despair
description: Iron armor singed and blistered by fingers.
Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold.

description: Iron gauntlets singed and blistered by fingers.

Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

Fingerprint Greaves.name: Fingerprint Greaves
Fingerprint Greaves.summary: Deformed greaves of a mad knight in despair
description: Iron greaves singed and blistered by fingers.
Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold.
No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy.
